name: Rumsfeld Game
description:
This is 'Rumsfeld Game', a new video game from Outhouse Media. 'Rumsfeld', the title of the 16-bit video game, even had a humorous political spin released years later. One of the characters was Larry the Cat and it was set in a dystopian future where the United States had been overrun by terrorists. In a campaign to save the world, players take control of an evil leader (the closest analogue to President Obama) who is determined to bring about a return to the glory days of American dominance.
The game comes with a selection of 'Rumsfeld Game' characters, and jokes and commentary. The game was created by a 1st generation college student who earned a degree in game design, and Blemish is one of the game's lead creators. Blemish also designed 'Spectral Voices', the first video game to give a voice to all the people who have never heard a voice in their life. Other members of the Blemish family have also worked on a number of video games such as Grid 2: Simulation + Design and Sudden Strike Underground. When asked by Grand Theft Auto Online why he did not try to work with the President, Blemish responded, "I had to study international relations, so I didn't know how to think about it and I was influenced by Bruce Willis, on the other hand when I was younger I felt I could do something different with that. The most important thing was that I was still trying to steer myself away from games," he shared.
